Articles.Content: No hate towards squad. It's just kinda funny that they would have that in their planned features page

From the page the video is pulling from:

 

Quote

The features listed here are planned for future versions of Kerbal Space Program and may change during the course of development.

This list is not an official road-map for KSP. It is maintained by the community, and has no direct relation to what may or may not be included in the final product. Already implemented features can be found in the version history.

 

https://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Planned_features

I think that line is specifically referencing mod utilities like mechjeb.  This isn't the first time they've added parts that already existed as mods.  Look at all the SLS inspired 3.75 meter rocket parts.

34 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:

Plans change. What's the issue? 

 

I don't know if the OP made the video, but I posted the same thing I said above there, and the reply was:

 

Quote

The point was that they stated "A few, such as autopilot systems, weapons, and realistically-sized celestial bodies are already available via mods." Yet they added parts that you could get from mods. I'm not saying i disagree with the update, it's just kinda silly that it says that there.﻿

 

*shrug*
What on earth is the point of that video? Pointing at a community-written wiki, and then at some Squad parts? What's happening?

I don't see an issue, development is a longer process than creating a couple of advertising graphics, things change.

I suppose it is worth remembering the new EULA, probably something in there along the lines of this trademarked product is owned by Squad, and if third party suggests or adds a MOD feature, then Squad has the right to ignore it or adopt it, and yes, that means Squad can sell it.

No problems here.

Since those parts are now technically stock, they will survive and be kept in good working order for as long as KSP itself is. Plus it's not exactly like bringing something into the stock game hurts anyone, it just shows that Squad thought that was such a good idea that it should be incorporated, even if it is a DLC. Happens all the time.
Community-maintained planned-features pages should probably be banned from game wikis. No one reads the fine print, it seems.
